result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

9:16 AM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Defendant Adam Patrick Kautz in court.  Attorney Rebecca Adams in court for Adam Patrick Kautz.  Prosecuting attorney Michael Joseph Becker in court for the State of Wisconsin. Includes 22CM514 & 22CT202.  Court reviews files.  Atty Adams states discovery was just requested, need another court date to review discovery once sent. DE verified address and phone number.  Bond continues. Adjourned at 9:17 AM. bph

Restitution worksheet/ Informational  $272.19. Filed by DA Office. arc

Includes 22CM514 and 22CT202.

$250 bond on file.

Maintain current treatment program.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, J.L.M. The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats. THIS CONDITION SHALL ONLY BE EFFECTIVE UPON THE EXPIRATION OF A 72 HOUR NO CONTACT ORDER.

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license or ignition interlock device. 

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

1:52 PM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Lindabaur. Prosecuting attorney Michael Becker appeared.  Jeremiah Harrelson appeared for Defendant for today. Defendant Adam Patrick Kautz in court, in custody. Includes 22CM514 and 22CT202. Defendant doesn't qualify for PD- PFAC given.  DE confirms address and DOB. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. Waive reading. NG. Bond argument; bond ordered. Court sets PSC in both files.  gll
